name.sv: Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik, Tentamen
name.en: First Course in Probability and Statistics, Exam

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Jokin yliopistotason matematiikan kurssi, esim. MS-A000X Matriisilaskenta tai MS-A010X Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Någon kurs i matematik (universitetnivå), till exempel MS-A000X Matrisräkning eller MS-A010X Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: University level mathematics course, for example MS-A000X Matrix algebra or MS-A010X Differential and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa laskea yhdistelmätapahtumien todennäköisyyksiä hyödyntämällä joukko-opin operaatioita
- tuntee tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat sekä tunnistaa tilanteita, joita niillä voi mallintaa
- osaa yhteisjakauman perusteella laskea satunnaisvektorin tunnuslukuja sekä tunnistaa, milloin kaksi satunnaismuuttujaa ovat stokastisesti riippumattomat
- tuntee menetelmiä tilastollisten mallien parametrien estimoimiseen
- osaa laskea posteriorijakaumia ja tehdä niistä päätelmiä
- osaa selittää, millaisia johtopäätöksiä voi ja ei voi tehdä valittuun tilastolliseen testiasetelmaan liittyvän p-arvon pohjalta
- osaa käyttää tietokonetta aineistojen ja todennäköisyysjakaumien tutkimiseen
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen skall studenten- kunna beräkna sannolikheten för sammansatta händelser genom att använda mängdoperationer- känna till de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna samt känna igen situationer som kan modelleras med hjälp av dessa- kunna applicera simultanfördelningar för att beräkna statistik för slumpvektorer samt känna igen när två stokastiska variabler är oberoende- känna till metoder för att skatta parametrar i statistiska modeller- kunna beräkna aposteriorifördelningar och göra slutledningar av dem- kunna förklara vilka slutledningar man kan och inte kan göra med hjälp av p-värde från ett statistiskt test- kunna använda en dator för att studera data och sannoliksfördelningar
learningOutcomes.en: After course the student- can compute probabilities of composite events by applying operations of set theory- is familiar with the most important discrete and continuous probability distributions and recognizes situations that can modeled with them- can apply joint distributions to compute statistics of random vectors and to recognize when two random variables are stochastically independent- knows methods for estimating the parameters of a statistical model- can compute posterior distributions and make conclusions based on them- can explain what can and what cannot be concluded from a p-value of chosen statistical test- can use a computer to investigate data sets and probability distributions

content.fi: - todennäköisyyden käsite ja peruslaskusäännöt- tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat- odotusarvo, otoskeskiarvo ja suurten lukujen laki- varianssi, otosvarianssi ja normaaliapproksimaatio- stokastinen riippuvuus ja korrelaatio- datan kuvaileminen tunnuslukujen ja histogrammin avulla- todennäköisyysjakauman parametrien estimointi- tilastollisen luottamusvälin käsite- priorijakauma, uskottavuusfunktio ja posteriorijakauma- yksinkertaisten tilastollisten hypoteesien testaaminen
content.sv: - sannolikhetsbegreppet och grundläggande räkneregler för sannolikheter- de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna- väntevärde, stickprovsmedelvärde och stora talens lag- varians, stickprovsvarians och normalapproximation- stokastiskt beroende och korrelation- beskrivning av data med hjälp av statistik och histogram- parameterskatting från statistiska modeller- begreppet konfidensintervall- apriorifördelning, likelihood-funktion och aposteriorifördelning- test av enkla statistiska hypoteser
content.en: - the notion of probability and its basic arithmetic rules- the most important discrete and continuous distributions- expectation, sample mean, and the law of large numbers- variance, sample variances, and normal approximation- stochastic dependence and correlation- description of data using statistics and histograms- parameter estimation of statistical models- the concept of a confidence interval- prior distribution, likelihood function, and posterior distribution- testing of simple statistical hypotheses

substitutes.fi: Korvaa kurssin Mat-1.2600 ja Mat-1.2620. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A050X Todennäköisyyslaskennan ja tilastotieteen peruskurssi / First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.
substitutes.sv: Ersätter kurser Mat-1.2600 och Mat-1.2620. Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A05XX Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik / First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.
substitutes.en: Substitutes the courses Mat-1.2600 and Mat-1.2620 and the courses MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli: suomi Opetusperiodi: 2024-2025 Syksy II  2024-2025 Kesä   2025-2026 Syksy II  2025-2026 Kesä
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket: finska Undervisningsperiod: 2024-2025 Höst II  2024-2025 Sommar   2025-2026 Höst II  2025-2026 Sommar

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

name.sv: Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik, Tentamen
name.en: First Course in Probability and Statistics, Exam

prerequisites.fi: Jokin yliopistotason matematiikan kurssi, esim. MS-A000X Matriisilaskenta tai MS-A010X Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
prerequisites.sv: Någon kurs i matematik (universitetnivå), till exempel MS-A000X Matrisräkning eller MS-A010X Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
prerequisites.en: University level mathematics course, for example MS-A000X Matrix algebra or MS-A010X Differential and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa laskea yhdistelmätapahtumien todennäköisyyksiä hyödyntämällä joukko-opin operaatioita
- tuntee tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat sekä tunnistaa tilanteita, joita niillä voi mallintaa
- osaa yhteisjakauman perusteella laskea satunnaisvektorin tunnuslukuja sekä tunnistaa, milloin kaksi satunnaismuuttujaa ovat stokastisesti riippumattomat
- tuntee menetelmiä tilastollisten mallien parametrien estimoimiseen
- osaa laskea posteriorijakaumia ja tehdä niistä päätelmiä
- osaa selittää, millaisia johtopäätöksiä voi ja ei voi tehdä valittuun tilastolliseen testiasetelmaan liittyvän p-arvon pohjalta
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen skall studenten- kunna beräkna sannolikheten för sammansatta händelser genom att använda mängdoperationer- känna till de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna samt känna igen situationer som kan modelleras med hjälp av dessa- kunna applicera simultanfördelningar för att beräkna statistik för slumpvektorer samt känna igen när två stokastiska variabler är oberoende- känna till metoder för att skatta parametrar i statistiska modeller- kunna beräkna aposteriorifördelningar och göra slutledningar av dem- kunna förklara vilka slutledningar man kan och inte kan göra med hjälp av p-värde från ett statistiskt test
learningOutcomes.en: After course the student- can compute probabilities of composite events by applying operations of set theory- is familiar with the most important discrete and continuous probability distributions and recognizes situations that can modeled with them- can apply joint distributions to compute statistics of random vectors and to recognize when two random variables are stochastically independent- knows methods for estimating the parameters of a statistical model- can compute posterior distributions and make conclusions based on them- can explain what can and what cannot be concluded from a p-value of chosen statistical test

literature.en: Lecture notes. Recommended auxiliary reading: Sheldon M Ross, Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists (5th ed), Academic Press 2014.
literature.fi: Luentomoniste. Suositeltavaa taustalukemista: Sheldon M Ross, Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists (5. p), Academic Press 2014.
literature.sv: Föreläsningsanteckningar. Rekommenderad bredvidläsning: Sheldon M Ross, Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists (5th ed), Academic Press 2014.

content.fi: - todennäköisyyden käsite ja peruslaskusäännöt- tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat- odotusarvo, otoskeskiarvo ja suurten lukujen laki- varianssi, otosvarianssi ja normaaliapproksimaatio- stokastinen riippuvuus ja korrelaatio- datan kuvaileminen tunnuslukujen ja histogrammin avulla- todennäköisyysjakauman parametrien estimointi- tilastollisen luottamusvälin käsite- priorijakauma, uskottavuusfunktio ja posteriorijakauma- yksinkertaisten tilastollisten hypoteesien testaaminen
content.sv: - sannolikhetsbegreppet och grundläggande räkneregler för sannolikheter- de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna- väntevärde, stickprovsmedelvärde och stora talens lag- varians, stickprovsvarians och normalapproximation- stokastiskt beroende och korrelation- beskrivning av data med hjälp av statistik och histogram- parameterskatting från statistiska modeller- begreppet konfidensintervall- apriorifördelning, likelihood-funktion och aposteriorifördelning- test av enkla statistiska hypoteser
content.en: - the notion of probability and its basic arithmetic rules- the most important discrete and continuous distributions- expectation, sample mean, and the law of large numbers- variance, sample variances, and normal approximation- stochastic dependence and correlation- description of data using statistics and histograms- parameter estimation of statistical models- the concept of a confidence interval- prior distribution, likelihood function, and posterior distribution- testing of simple statistical hypotheses

substitutes.fi: Korvaa kurssin Mat-1.2600 ja Mat-1.2620. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A050X Todennäköisyyslaskennan ja tilastotieteen peruskurssi / First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.
substitutes.sv: Ersätter kurser Mat-1.2600 och Mat-1.2620. Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A05XX Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik / First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.
substitutes.en: Substitutes the courses Mat-1.2600 and Mat-1.2620 and the courses MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.

additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsperiod: 2020-2021 Vår IV 2021-2022 Vår IVKursens webbplats: https://mycourses.aalto.fi/course/search.php?search=MS-A0504Anmälning: Anmälan till undervisningen för läsåret 2021-2022 sker i Sisu, inte i WebOodi.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

name.sv: Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik, Tentamen
name.en: First Course in Probability and Statistics, Exam

prerequisites.fi: Jokin yliopistotason matematiikan kurssi, esim. MS-A000X Matriisilaskenta tai MS-A010X Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
prerequisites.sv: Någon kurs i matematik (universitetnivå), till exempel MS-A000X Matrisräkning eller MS-A010X Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
prerequisites.en: University level mathematics course, for example MS-A000X Matrix algebra or MS-A010X Differential and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa laskea yhdistelmätapahtumien todennäköisyyksiä hyödyntämällä joukko-opin operaatioita
- tuntee tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat sekä tunnistaa tilanteita, joita niillä voi mallintaa
- osaa yhteisjakauman perusteella laskea satunnaisvektorin tunnuslukuja sekä tunnistaa, milloin kaksi satunnaismuuttujaa ovat stokastisesti riippumattomat
- tuntee menetelmiä tilastollisten mallien parametrien estimoimiseen
- osaa laskea posteriorijakaumia ja tehdä niistä päätelmiä
- osaa selittää, millaisia johtopäätöksiä voi ja ei voi tehdä valittuun tilastolliseen testiasetelmaan liittyvän p-arvon pohjalta
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen skall studenten- kunna beräkna sannolikheten för sammansatta händelser genom att använda mängdoperationer- känna till de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna samt känna igen situationer som kan modelleras med hjälp av dessa- kunna applicera simultanfördelningar för att beräkna statistik för slumpvektorer samt känna igen när två stokastiska variabler är oberoende- känna till metoder för att skatta parametrar i statistiska modeller- kunna beräkna aposteriorifördelningar och göra slutledningar av dem- kunna förklara vilka slutledningar man kan och inte kan göra med hjälp av p-värde från ett statistiskt test
learningOutcomes.en: After course the student- can compute probabilities of composite events by applying operations of set theory- is familiar with the most important discrete and continuous probability distributions and recognizes situations that can modeled with them- can apply joint distributions to compute statistics of random vectors and to recognize when two random variables are stochastically independent- knows methods for estimating the parameters of a statistical model- can compute posterior distributions and make conclusions based on them- can explain what can and what cannot be concluded from a p-value of chosen statistical test

literature.en: Lecture notes. Recommended auxiliary reading: Sheldon M Ross, Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists (5th ed), Academic Press 2014.
literature.fi: Luentomoniste. Suositeltavaa taustalukemista: Sheldon M Ross, Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists (5. p), Academic Press 2014.
literature.sv: Föreläsningsanteckningar. Rekommenderad bredvidläsning: Sheldon M Ross, Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists (5th ed), Academic Press 2014.

content.fi: - todennäköisyyden käsite ja peruslaskusäännöt- tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat- odotusarvo, otoskeskiarvo ja suurten lukujen laki- varianssi, otosvarianssi ja normaaliapproksimaatio- stokastinen riippuvuus ja korrelaatio- datan kuvaileminen tunnuslukujen ja histogrammin avulla- todennäköisyysjakauman parametrien estimointi- tilastollisen luottamusvälin käsite- priorijakauma, uskottavuusfunktio ja posteriorijakauma- yksinkertaisten tilastollisten hypoteesien testaaminen
content.sv: - sannolikhetsbegreppet och grundläggande räkneregler för sannolikheter- de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna- väntevärde, stickprovsmedelvärde och stora talens lag- varians, stickprovsvarians och normalapproximation- stokastiskt beroende och korrelation- beskrivning av data med hjälp av statistik och histogram- parameterskatting från statistiska modeller- begreppet konfidensintervall- apriorifördelning, likelihood-funktion och aposteriorifördelning- test av enkla statistiska hypoteser
content.en: - the notion of probability and its basic arithmetic rules- the most important discrete and continuous distributions- expectation, sample mean, and the law of large numbers- variance, sample variances, and normal approximation- stochastic dependence and correlation- description of data using statistics and histograms- parameter estimation of statistical models- the concept of a confidence interval- prior distribution, likelihood function, and posterior distribution- testing of simple statistical hypotheses

substitutes.fi: Korvaa kurssin Mat-1.2600 ja Mat-1.2620. Voidaan korvata kursseilla MS-A050X Todennäköisyyslaskennan ja tilastotieteen peruskurssi / First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.
substitutes.sv: Ersätter kurser Mat-1.2600 och Mat-1.2620. Kan ersättes med kurser MS-A05XX Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik / First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.
substitutes.en: Substitutes the courses Mat-1.2600 and Mat-1.2620 and the courses MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A0510 Mathematics 3.

content.fi: - todennäköisyyden käsite ja peruslaskusäännöt- tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat- odotusarvo, otoskeskiarvo ja suurten lukujen laki- varianssi, otosvarianssi ja normaaliapproksimaatio- stokastinen riippuvuus ja korrelaatio- datan kuvaileminen tunnuslukujen ja histogrammin avulla- todennäköisyysjakauman parametrien estimointi- tilastollisen luottamusvälin käsite- priorijakauma, uskottavuusfunktio ja posteriorijakauma- yksinkertaisten tilastollisten hypoteesien testaaminen
content.sv: - sannolikhetsbegreppet och grundläggande räkneregler för sannolikheter- de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna- väntevärde, stickprovsmedelvärde och stora talens lag- varians, stickprovsvarians och normalapproximation- stokastiskt beroende och korrelation- beskrivning av data med hjälp av statistik och histogram- parameterskatting från statistiska modeller- begreppet konfidensintervall- apriorifördelning, likelihood-funktion och aposteriorifördelning- test av enkla statistiska hypoteser
content.en: - the notion of probability and its basic arithmetic rules- the most important discrete and continuous distributions- expectation, sample mean, and the law of large numbers- variance, sample variances, and normal approximation- stochastic dependence and correlation- description of data using statistics and histograms- parameter estimation of statistical models- the concept of a confidence interval- prior distribution, likelihood function, and posterior distribution- testing of simple statistical hypotheses

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

name.sv: Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik, Tentamen
name.en: First Course in Probability and Statistics, Exam

workload.fi: Osallistuminen luennoille 24 h (4 h/viikko) Osallistuminen harjoituksiin 24 h (4 h/viikko) Viikottainen itsenäinen opiskelu 36-72 h (6-12 h/viikko) Osallistuminen ja valmistautuminen kokeisiin 4-40 h
workload.sv: Deltagande vid föreläsningar 24 timmar (4 timmar/vecka) Deltagande vid räkneövningar 24 timmar (4 timmar/vecka) Självständiga studier 36-72 timmar (6-12 timmar/vecka) Förberedelser för och deltagande vid examination 4-40 timmar
workload.en: Participating in lectures 24 h (4 h/week)Participating in exercises classes 24 h (4 h/week)Weekly independent study 36-72 h (6-12 h/week)Participating and preparing for exams 4-40 h

prerequisites.fi: Jokin yliopistotason matematiikan kurssi, esim. MS-A000X Matriisilaskenta tai MS-A010X Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
prerequisites.sv: Någon kurs i matematik (universitetnivå), till exempel MS-A000X Matrisräkning eller MS-A010X Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
prerequisites.en: University level mathematics course, for example MS-A000X Matrix algebra or MS-A010X Differential and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa laskea yhdistelmätapahtumien todennäköisyyksiä hyödyntämällä joukko-opin operaatioita
- tuntee tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat sekä tunnistaa tilanteita, joita niillä voi mallintaa
- osaa yhteisjakauman perusteella laskea satunnaisvektorin tunnuslukuja sekä tunnistaa, milloin kaksi satunnaismuuttujaa ovat stokastisesti riippumattomat
- tuntee menetelmiä tilastollisten mallien parametrien estimoimiseen
- osaa laskea posteriorijakaumia ja tehdä niistä päätelmiä
- osaa selittää, millaisia johtopäätöksiä voi ja ei voi tehdä valittuun tilastolliseen testiasetelmaan liittyvän p-arvon pohjalta
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen skall studenten- kunna beräkna sannolikheten för sammansatta händelser genom att använda mängdoperationer- känna till de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna samt känna igen situationer som kan modelleras med hjälp av dessa- kunna applicera simultanfördelningar för att beräkna statistik för slumpvektorer samt känna igen när två stokastiska variabler är oberoende- känna till metoder för att skatta parametrar i statistiska modeller- kunna beräkna aposteriorifördelningar och göra slutledningar av dem- kunna förklara vilka slutledningar man kan och inte kan göra med hjälp av p-värde från ett statistiskt test
learningOutcomes.en: After course the student- can compute probabilities of composite events by applying operations of set theory- is familiar with the most important discrete and continuous probability distributions and recognizes situations that can modeled with them- can apply joint distributions to compute statistics of random vectors and to recognize when two random variables are stochastically independent- knows methods for estimating the parameters of a statistical model- can compute posterior distributions and make conclusions based on them- can explain what can and what cannot be concluded from a p-value of chosen statistical test

literature.en: Lecture notes. Recommended auxiliary reading: Sheldon M Ross, Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists (5th ed), Academic Press 2014.
literature.fi: Luentomoniste. Suositeltavaa taustalukemista: Sheldon M Ross, Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists (5. p), Academic Press 2014.

content.fi: - todennäköisyyden käsite ja peruslaskusäännöt- tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat- odotusarvo, otoskeskiarvo ja suurten lukujen laki- varianssi, otosvarianssi ja normaaliapproksimaatio- stokastinen riippuvuus ja korrelaatio- datan kuvaileminen tunnuslukujen ja histogrammin avulla- todennäköisyysjakauman parametrien estimointi- tilastollisen luottamusvälin käsite- priorijakauma, uskottavuusfunktio ja posteriorijakauma- yksinkertaisten tilastollisten hypoteesien testaaminen
content.sv: - sannolikhetsbegreppet och grundläggande räkneregler för sannolikheter- de viktigaste diskreta och kontinuerliga sannolikhetsfördelningarna- väntevärde, stickprovsmedelvärde och stora talens lag- varians, stickprovsvarians och normalapproximation- stokastiskt beroende och korrelation- beskrivning av data med hjälp av statistik och histogram- parameterskatting från statistiska modeller- begreppet konfidensintervall- apriorifördelning, likelihood-funktion och aposteriorifördelning- test av enkla statistiska hypoteser
content.en: - the notion of probability and its basic arithmetic rules- the most important discrete and continuous distributions- expectation, sample mean, and the law of large numbers- variance, sample variances, and normal approximation- stochastic dependence and correlation- description of data using statistics and histograms- parameter estimation of statistical models- the concept of a confidence interval- prior distribution, likelihood function, and posterior distribution- testing of simple statistical hypotheses

assesmentMethods.en: lectures, exercises and course exam OR exam only

workload.fi: Osallistuminen luennoille 24 h (4 h/viikko)Osallistuminen harjoituksiin 24 h (4 h/viikko)Viikottainen itsenäinen opiskelu 36-72 h (6-12 h/viikko)Osallistuminen ja valmistautuminen kokeisiin 4-40 h
workload.sv: Deltagande vid föreläsningar 24 timmar (4 timmar/vecka)Deltagande vid räkneövningar 24 timmar (4 timmar/vecka)Självständiga studier 36-72 timmar (6-12 timmar/vecka)Förberedelser för och deltagande vid examination 4-40 timmar
workload.en: Participating in lectures 24 h (4 h/week)Participating in exercises classes 24 h (4 h/week)Weekly independent study 36-72 h (6-12 h/week)Participating and preparing for exams 4-40 h

prerequisites.fi: Jokin yliopistotason matematiikan kurssi, esim. MS-A000X Matriisilaskenta tai MS-A010X Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1.
prerequisites.sv: Någon kurs i matematik (universitetnivå), till exempel MS-A000X Matrisräkning eller MS-A010X Differential- och integralkalkyl 1.
prerequisites.en: University level mathematics course, for example MS-A000X Matrix algebra or MS-A010X Differential and integral calculus 1.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
- osaa laskea yhdistelmätapahtumien todennäköisyyksiä hyödyntämällä joukko-opin operaatioita
- tuntee tärkeimmät diskreetit ja jatkuvat todennäköisyysjakaumat sekä tunnistaa tilanteita, joita niillä voi mallintaa
- osaa yhteisjakauman perusteella laskea satunnaisvektorin tunnuslukuja sekä tunnistaa, milloin kaksi satunnaismuuttujaa ovat stokastisesti riippumattomat
- tuntee menetelmiä tilastollisten mallien parametrien estimoimiseen
- osaa laskea posteriorijakaumia ja tehdä niistä päätelmiä
- osaa selittää, millaisia johtopäätöksiä voi ja ei voi tehdä valittuun tilastolliseen testiasetelmaan liittyvän p-arvon pohjalta

prerequisites.fi: The student should be familiar with basic proof techniques, sets, functions, and relations, especially modular arithmetic and the congruence relation. These are covered on the course MS-A04XX Foundations of discrete mathematics, and typically in any standard book on abstract algebra. Finnish-speaking students can also looks at the lecture notes: Metsänkylä-Näätänen, Algebra, sections 0, I, II, matematiikkalehtisolmu.fi/2010/algebra.pdf).
prerequisites.sv: The student should be familiar with basic proof techniques, sets, functions, and relations, especially modular arithmetic and the congruence relation. These are covered on the course MS-A04XX Foundations of discrete mathematics, and typically in any standard book on abstract algebra. Finnish-speaking students can also looks at the lecture notes: Metsänkylä-Näätänen, Algebra, sections 0, I, II, matematiikkalehtisolmu.fi/2010/algebra.pdf).
prerequisites.en: The student should be familiar with basic proof techniques, sets, functions, and relations, especially modular arithmetic and the congruence relation. These are covered on the course MS-A04XX Foundations of discrete mathematics, and typically in any standard book on abstract algebra. Finnish-speaking students can also looks at the lecture notes: Metsänkylä-Näätänen, Algebra, sections 0, I, II, matematiikkalehtisolmu.fi/2010/algebra.pdf).

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will be able to
-understand basic algebraic structures and their key properties and differencies,
-perform related arithmetics
-master and apply different proof techniques.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student will
- be able to make use of complex numbers in solving geometric problems
- be able to solve mapping problems in the plane
- recognize behavior of complex functions
- be able to interprete basic properties of analytic functions
- be able calculate real integrals by making use of complex integrals

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student will
- be able to make use of complex numbers in solving geometric problems
- be able to solve mapping problems in the plane
- recognize behavior of complex functions
- be able to interprete basic properties of analytic functions
- be able calculate real integrals by making use of complex integrals
learningOutcomes.sv: After passing the course the student will - be able to make use of complex numbers in solving geometric problems - be able to solve mapping problems in the plane - recognize behavior of complex functions - be able to interprete basic properties of analytic functions - be able calculate real integrals by making use of complex integrals
learningOutcomes.en: After passing the course the student will - be able to make use of complex numbers in solving geometric problems - be able to solve mapping problems in the plane - recognize behavior of complex functions - be able to interprete basic properties of analytic functions - be able calculate real integrals by making use of complex integrals

content.fi: The interpretation and use of complex numbers, analytic function, conformality, harmonic function, basic complex functions, line integrals, sequences and series, Cauchy formula and its consequences.
content.sv: The interpretation and use of complex numbers, analytic function, conformality, harmonic function, basic complex functions, line integrals, sequences and series, Cauchy formula and its consequences.
content.en: The interpretation and use of complex numbers, analytic function, conformality, harmonic function, basic complex functions, line integrals, sequences and series, Cauchy formula and its consequences.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A00XX Matriisilaskenta, MS-A02XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A00XX Matrisräkning, MS-A02XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 2.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A00XX Matrix algebra, MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija ymmärtää lineaarialgbran peruskäsitteet ja hänellä on teoreettinen ymmärrys lineaarisista yhtälöryhmistä, pienimmän neliösumman tehtävistä ja ominaisarvotehtävistä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter fullgjord kurs studenten förstår grundläggande koncept inom linjär algebra och har teoretisk förståelse av linjära system, minsta kvadratmetod och egenvärdesproblem.
learningOutcomes.en: After passing the course the student has obtained an understanding of the basic concepts of linear algebra. He/she has theoretical understanding of linear systems, least squares problems and eigenvalue problems.

content.fi: Lineaariagbran peruskäsitteet. Lineaariset yhtälöryhmät, pienimmän neliösumman ongelmat ja ominaisarvotehtävät.
content.sv: Grundläggande koncept inom linjär algebra. Linjära system, minsta kvadratmetod och egenvärdesproblem.
content.en: Basic theoretical concepts in linear algebra. Linear systems, least squares problems and eigenvalue problems.

substitutes.fi:
Korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1132, Mat-1.1332, Mat-1.1532, Mat-1.1632, MS-C1340, MS-C1343.




Yhdessä kurssin MS-C1300 Kompleksianalyysi kanssa korvaa kurssin Mat-1.1030.




Yhdessä kurssin MS-C1300 Kompleksianalyysi tai kurssin MS-1420 Fourier-analyysi kanssa korvaa kurssin Mat-1.1230.
substitutes.sv:
Kan ersättes med kurser Mat-1.1132, Mat-1.1332, Mat-1.1532, Mat-1.1632, MS-C1340, MS-C1342.
Tillsammans med kursen MS-C1300 Komplex analys ersätter kursen Mat-1.1030.
Tillsammans med kursen MS-C1300 Komplex analys eller MS-1420 Fourier analys ersätter kursen Mat-1.1230.
substitutes.en:
Substitutes the courses Mat-1.1132, Mat-1.1332, Mat-1.1532, Mat-1.1632, MS-C1340, MS-C1342.
Together with the course MS-C1300 Complex analysis substitutes the course Mat-1.1030.
Together with the course MS-C1300 Complex analysis or the course MS-C1420 Fourier analysis substitutes the course Mat-1.1230.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course student knows - how to solve partial differential equations using separation of variables and Fourier techniques 
- the physical interpretations of the equations
- the equations in the spherical and cylindrical coordinates
- the role of the fundamental solutions
- the maximum and comparison principles
- the variational forms of the equations.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A01XX Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1, MS-A00XX Matriisilaskenta.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A01XX Differential- och integralkalkyl 1, MS-A00XX Matrisräkning.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A01XX Differential and integral calculus 1, MS-A00XX Matrix algebra.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa
- perustella Fourier-muunnosten keskeiset ominaisuudet
- laskea helppoja Fourier-muunnoksia käsin
- yhdistää Fourier-muunnosten teorian signaalinkäsittelyn käytännön ongelmiin
- käyttää tietokonetta todellisten signaalien Fourier-analyysissa.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter att ha avklarat denna kurs skall studenten
- behärska de viktigaste egenskaper av Fouriertransformer - kunna räkna ut enkla Fouriertransformationer för hand - kunna använda teorin för Fouriertransformer vid praktiska problem inom signalbehandling. - Kunna använda dator för att göra en Fourieranalys av verkliga signaler.
learningOutcomes.en: After passing the course the student will be able to - justify the essential properties of Fourier transforms - calculate easy Fourier transforms by hand - connect the theory of Fourier transforms to practical applications in signal processing - use computer in Fourier analysis of real-life signals.

content.fi: Fourier-integraali, Fourier-sarja, diskreetti Fourier-muunnos ja FFT. Ikkunoitu Fourier-muunnos ja spektrogrammi. Sovellukset signaalinkäsittelyyn.
content.sv: Fourierintegral, Fourierserier, diskret Fouriertransform och FFT. Korttids Fouriertransform och spektrogram. Tilllämpningar inom signalbehandling.
content.en: Fourier integral, Fourier series, discrete Fourier transform and FFT. Windowed Fourier transform and spectrogram. Applications in signal processing.

substitutes.fi: Korvaa kurssit Mat-1.1131, Mat-1.1331, Mat-1.1531, Mat-1.1631, MS-C1421. Yhdessä joko kurssin MS-C1340/MS-C1342 tai kurssin MS-C1300 kanssa korvaa kurssin Mat-1.1230.
substitutes.sv: Ersätter kurser Mat-1.1131, Mat-1.1331, Mat-1.1531, Mat-1.1631, MS-C1421. Tillsammans med kursen MS-C1340/MS-C1342 eller kursen MS-C1300 ersätter kursen Mat-1.1230.
substitutes.en: Substitutes the courses Mat-1.1131, Mat-1.1331, Mat-1.1531, Mat-1.1631, MS-C1421. Together with the course MS-C1340/MS-C1342 or the course MS-C1300 substitutes the course Mat-1.1230.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student knows - methods of rigorous reasoning in mathematical analysis - basic topology of inner product spaces, normed spaces, and metric spaces
- the notions of limit and continuity
- the definitions and fundamental properties of compactness, completeness, and connectedness in metric spaces.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After passing the course the student knows
- methods of rigorous reasoning in mathematical analysis
- basic topology of inner product spaces, normed spaces, and metric spaces- the notions of limit and continuity- the definitions and fundamental properties of compactness, completeness, and connectedness in metric spaces.
learningOutcomes.en:
After passing the course the student knows
- methods of rigorous reasoning in mathematical analysis
- basic topology of inner product spaces, normed spaces, and metric spaces- the notions of limit and continuity- the definitions and fundamental properties of compactness, completeness, and connectedness in metric spaces.

prerequisites.fi: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A00XX Matrix algebra
prerequisites.sv: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A00XX Matrix algebra
prerequisites.en: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A00XX Matrix algebra

learningOutcomes.fi: After passing the course the students can conduct simple statistical analyses. They know how to calculate summary statistics and how to properly visualize data. Students are able to select suitable summary statistics and parameter estimates for different types of data sets and construct bootstrap confidence intervals for the estimated parameters. Students are able to select suitable statistical tests for different testing settings. They know how to apply different t-tests, chi-square tests and nonparametric tests and understand the general statistical assumptions that are required for applying these tests. Students are able to detect different types of dependencies between variables and they are familiar with univariate and multivariate linear regression analysis. They can conduct linear regression analysis in practice and they understand the underlying model assumptions.
learningOutcomes.sv: After passing the course the students can conduct simple statistical analyses. They know how to calculate summary statistics and how to properly visualize data. Students are able to select suitable summary statistics and parameter estimates for different types of data sets and construct bootstrap confidence intervals for the estimated parameters. Students are able to select suitable statistical tests for different testing settings. They know how to apply different t-tests, chi-square tests and nonparametric tests and understand the general statistical assumptions that are required for applying these tests. Students are able to detect different types of dependencies between variables and they are familiar with univariate and multivariate linear regression analysis. They can conduct linear regression analysis in practice and they understand the underlying model assumptions.
learningOutcomes.en: After passing the course the students can conduct simple statistical analyses. They know how to calculate summary statistics and how to properly visualize data. Students are able to select suitable summary statistics and parameter estimates for different types of data sets and construct bootstrap confidence intervals for the estimated parameters. Students are able to select suitable statistical tests for different testing settings. They know how to apply different t-tests, chi-square tests and nonparametric tests and understand the general statistical assumptions that are required for applying these tests. Students are able to detect different types of dependencies between variables and they are familiar with univariate and multivariate linear regression analysis. They can conduct linear regression analysis in practice and they understand the underlying model assumptions.

content.fi: The course is an introduction to statistical analysis and statistical inference. Course topics include estimation, simple parametric and nonparametric tests, statistical dependence and correlation, linear regression analysis and analysis of variance. Software R is used in this course.
content.sv: The course is an introduction to statistical analysis and statistical inference. Course topics include estimation, simple parametric and nonparametric tests, statistical dependence and correlation, linear regression analysis and analysis of variance. Software R is used in this course.
content.en: The course is an introduction to statistical analysis and statistical inference. Course topics include estimation, simple parametric and nonparametric tests, statistical dependence and correlation, linear regression analysis and analysis of variance. Software R is used in this course.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A000X Matrix algebra and MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2 or equivalent knowledge.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A000X Matrix algebra and MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2 or equivalent knowledge.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A000X Matrix algebra and MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2 or equivalent knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon completing the course, the student
1. is familiar with the most common types of stochastic processes used in the modeling of random phenomena, and is aware of their underlying assumptions,
2. can apply stochastic processes to modeling and analyzing random phenomena,
3. is prepared to extend his/her knowledge to more sophisticated models, for example using the scientific literature in the field.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2, and MS-A00XX Matrix algebra.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2, and MS-A00XX Matrix algebra.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics, MS-A02XX Differential and integral calculus 2, and MS-A00XX Matrix algebra.

learningOutcomes.fi: After passing the course the students can analyse and forecast time series using regression models and ARIMA-models. Students are able to apply linear regression model to analyse and forecast dependent variable under the model assumptions. In addition, the students are able to conduct diagnostic tests to validate the model assumptions. Students are familiar with the concept weakly stationary processes and they understand the most important related concepts including the autocorrelation function, and partial autocorrelation function. Students are also able to apply these functions in analysing real time series, for example, in recognising seasonal fluctuations. After taking the course, the students know ARIMA-models and their key properties. In addition, the students are able to model and predict the future behaviour of observed time series using ARIMA-models. The students also know basic concepts of dynamic regression models.

content.fi: The course is an introduction to time series analysis. Course topics include linear regression model and its diagnostics, central concepts of weakly stationary processes, ARIMA-models and their properties, stationarity of ARIMA-models, forecasting with ARIMA-models, Kalman filter, and introduction to dynamic regression models. Software R is used in the exercises of the course.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

learningOutcomes.fi: Opintojakson jälkeen opiskelija pystyy ymmärtämään ja arvioimaan filosofista lähestymistapaa tieteeseen.

content.fi: Tieteen ja tieteellisen ajattelun tunnuspiirteiden systemaattinen tarkastelu sekä eri aikojen käsitykset tieteen tavoitteista, menetelmistä sekä tieteellisen tiedon luonteesta. Tieteen ja tekniikan suhde eri aikoina. Matemaattisten ja fysikaalisten tieteiden perusteet, tavoitteet ja menetelmät filosofisesta näkökulmasta. Myös historiallinen kehitys antiikin ajattelijoista tieteiden vallankumoukseen ja edelleen nykypäivän keskeisiin näkemyksiin asti. Logiikka ja argumentaatioteoria, tieteellinen päättely, sen luonne ja tavoitteet, tieteellinen selittäminen ja kausaliteetin ongelmat. Tieteen etiikka ja tieteellinen maailmankuva. Tiedon kasvuun ja tieteen kehitykseen liittyvät kysymykset.
content.sv:
En systematisk behandling av de utmärkande dragen i vetenskapen och det vetenskapliga tänkandet och uppfattningar under olika tidevarv om metoder och målsättningar för vetenskapen och arten av vetenskaplig kunskap.
Grunder, målsättningar och metoder i de matematiska och fysikaliska vetenskaperna ur en filosofisk synvinkel. Den historiska utvecklingen från antikens tänkare till den vetenskapliga revolutionen och vidare till centrala nutida åsikter. Logik och argumentationsteori. Vetenskaplig slutledning, dess natur och målsättningar. Vetenskapliga förklaringar och kausalitetsproblem. Vetenskapens etik och den vetenskapliga världsbilden. Frågor som gäller kunskapstillväxten och utvecklingen av vetenskapen.
content.en: The course deals mainly the foundations, objectives, and the methods in the mathematical and physical sciences from a philosophical point of view. The course proceeds historically from the philosophers of antiquity to the scientific revolution and from there to the essential modern philosophies. The characteristic features of science and of scientific thinking are systematically treated as well as concepts about the methods and the objectives of science and the nature of scientific knowledge during different periods. Systematical consideration of science and scientific thinking and the conceptions concerning objectives, methods and the nature of scientific knowledge during different times. Foundations, objectives and methods of mathematical and physical sciences from the philosophical point of view. The historical development from antiquity through the scientific revolution until the main perspectives of modern times. The scientific establishment of theories and concepts, scientific reasoning, its nature and objectives, scientific explanation and causality, the ethics of science and questions pertaining to the scientific world view, growth of knowledge and the development of science.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli : suomi Opetusperiodi : 2022-2023 Ei opetusta  2023-2024 Syksy I - II Ilmoittautuminen : Opetukseen ilmoittaudutaan Sisussa (sisu.aalto.fi).
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket : finska Undervisningsperiod : 2022-2023 Ingen undervisning  2023-2024 Höst I - II Anmälning : Anmälan till undervisningen sker i Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi).
additionalInformation.en: Teaching Language : Finnish Teaching Period : 2022-2023 No teaching  2023-2024 Autumn I - II Enrollment : Registration takes place in Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi).

workload.sv: 48 t (föreläsningar), 56 t (repetition av föreläsningar), 26 t (läsning av annan litteratur)
workload.en: 48 hours (lectures), 56 t (repetition), 26 t (additional literature)

learningOutcomes.fi: Opintojakson jälkeen opiskelija pystyy ymmärtämään ja arvioimaan filosofista lähestymistapaa tieteeseen.

content.fi: Tieteen ja tieteellisen ajattelun tunnuspiirteiden systemaattinen tarkastelu sekä eri aikojen käsitykset tieteen tavoitteista, menetelmistä sekä tieteellisen tiedon luonteesta. Tieteen ja tekniikan suhde eri aikoina. Matemaattisten ja fysikaalisten tieteiden perusteet, tavoitteet ja menetelmät filosofisesta näkökulmasta. Myös historiallinen kehitys antiikin ajattelijoista tieteiden vallankumoukseen ja edelleen nykypäivän keskeisiin näkemyksiin asti. Logiikka ja argumentaatioteoria, tieteellinen päättely, sen luonne ja tavoitteet, tieteellinen selittäminen ja kausaliteetin ongelmat. Tieteen etiikka ja tieteellinen maailmankuva. Tiedon kasvuun ja tieteen kehitykseen liittyvät kysymykset.
content.sv:
En systematisk behandling av de utmärkande dragen i vetenskapen och det vetenskapliga tänkandet och uppfattningar under olika tidevarv om metoder och målsättningar för vetenskapen och arten av vetenskaplig kunskap.
Grunder, målsättningar och metoder i de matematiska och fysikaliska vetenskaperna ur en filosofisk synvinkel. Den historiska utvecklingen från antikens tänkare till den vetenskapliga revolutionen och vidare till centrala nutida åsikter. Logik och argumentationsteori. Vetenskaplig slutledning, dess natur och målsättningar. Vetenskapliga förklaringar och kausalitetsproblem. Vetenskapens etik och den vetenskapliga världsbilden. Frågor som gäller kunskapstillväxten och utvecklingen av vetenskapen.
content.en: The course deals mainly the foundations, objectives, and the methods in the mathematical and physical sciences from a philosophical point of view. The course proceeds historically from the philosophers of antiquity to the scientific revolution and from there to the essential modern philosophies. The characteristic features of science and of scientific thinking are systematically treated as well as concepts about the methods and the objectives of science and the nature of scientific knowledge during different periods. Systematical consideration of science and scientific thinking and the conceptions concerning objectives, methods and the nature of scientific knowledge during different times. Foundations, objectives and methods of mathematical and physical sciences from the philosophical point of view. The historical development from antiquity through the scientific revolution until the main perspectives of modern times. The scientific establishment of theories and concepts, scientific reasoning, its nature and objectives, scientific explanation and causality, the ethics of science and questions pertaining to the scientific world view, growth of knowledge and the development of science.

assesmentMethods.sv: Inlärningsdagbok eller skriftlig tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: Written essay(s) or a written exam.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

learningOutcomes.fi: Opintojakson jälkeen opiskelija pystyy ymmärtämään ja arvioimaan, miten tiede on eri aikoina vaikuttanut maailmankuvaan ja miten maailmankuva (mahdollisesti) on vaikuttanut tieteeseen.
learningOutcomes.sv: Kan förstå och bedöma hur vetenskapen under olika tider har påverkat världsbilden och hur världsbilden (eventuellt) har påverkat vetenskapen.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student can understand and evaluate, how science has affected the world view and how the world view has (possibly) affected science.

content.fi: Valitut kohdat tiedehistoriasta antiikista uudelle ajalle asti. Asioiden ymmärtäminen tieteen metodisen kehityksen ja tieteellisestä metodista esitettyjen teorioiden kannalta. Järjestelmällisen tieteenharjoituksen synty Kreikassa, Aristoteleen rooli filosofian ja tieteiden isänä, hänen teostensa asema keskiajan eurooppalaisissa yliopistoissa. Luonnontieteen nousu 1600-luvulla, ns. "tieteen suuri vallankumous". Tämän vallankumouksen yhtenä tärkeänä teemana oli tähtitieteen kehitys. Em. kauden keskeisten matemaattis-fysikaalisten keksintöjen takaa löytyvät hahmot: mm. Kopernikus, Brahe, Kepler, Bacon, Galilei, Descartes, Newton ja Leibniz. Valittuja kohtia uudemmasta tiedehistoriasta (mm. Einstein).
content.sv:
Valda delar av vetenskapshistorien från antiken till nya tiden. Förståelse av olika fenomen med utgångspunkt i den metodiska utvecklingen av vetenskapen och de teorier som framställts beträffande vetenskapliga metoder. 
Uppkomsten av systematiska vetenskaper i Grekland, Aristoteles roll som filosofins och vetenskapens fader, och hans verks ställning i de medeltida europeiska universiteten. Den vetenskapliga uppgången under 1600-talet, "den stora vetenskapliga revolutionen". Ett viktigt tema i denna revolution var utvecklingen i astronomi. Bakom de centrala matematisk-fysikaliska upptäckterna under perioden finns personer som t.ex. Kopernikus, Brahe, Kepler, Bacon, Galilei, Descartes, Newton och Leibniz. Valda delar av nyare vetenskapshistoria (bl.a. Einstein).
content.en: The course examines the history of science by way of selected topics from antiquity to the twentieth century. The emphasis is on the methodological development of science and on the theories developed to deal with scientific method.  Understanding the material from the methodological development of science point of view. The rise of systematic science in Greece. The role of Aristotle as the father of philosophy and science, and the status of his works in medieval universities. The great scientific advances made during the 17th century, often called "the great scientific revolution", are treated. An important theme in this revolution was the development of astronomy. Behind the central mathematical-physical discoveries during the period were persons like Kopernikus, Brahe, Kepler, Bacon, Galilei, Descartes, Newton and Leibniz. In addition the course treats certain parts of more recent history of science (e.g. Einstein).

substitutes.sv: Kursen kan avläggas som självstudiekurs på engelska.
substitutes.en: The course can be taken in English as a literature exam upon request.

learningOutcomes.fi: You will learn about norms and inner products in infinite-dimensional vector spaces. Related to these structures, you will understand basic properties of bounded linear operators and duality in Hilbert spaces, together with diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators.
learningOutcomes.sv: You will learn about norms and inner products in infinite-dimensional vector spaces. Related to these structures, you will understand basic properties of bounded linear operators and duality in Hilbert spaces, together with diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators.
learningOutcomes.en: You will learn about norms and inner products in infinite-dimensional vector spaces. Related to these structures, you will understand basic properties of bounded linear operators and duality in Hilbert spaces, together with diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators.

content.fi: Orthogonality, orthonormal bases, bounded linear operators, functionals, and elementary spectral theory in Hilbert spaces. (Jordan-von Neuman Theorem, Riesz Hilbert Space Representation Theorem, diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators, Hilbert-Schmidt Spectral Theorem, Singular Value Decomposition).
content.sv: Orthogonality, orthonormal bases, bounded linear operators, functionals, and elementary spectral theory in Hilbert spaces. (Jordan-von Neuman Theorem, Riesz Hilbert Space Representation Theorem, diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators, Hilbert-Schmidt Spectral Theorem, Singular Value Decomposition).
content.en: Orthogonality, orthonormal bases, bounded linear operators, functionals, and elementary spectral theory in Hilbert spaces. (Jordan-von Neuman Theorem, Riesz Hilbert Space Representation Theorem, diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators, Hilbert-Schmidt Spectral Theorem, Singular Value Decomposition).

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-C1540
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-C1540
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-C1540

learningOutcomes.fi: You will learn about norms and inner products in infinite-dimensional vector spaces. Related to these structures, you will understand basic properties of bounded linear operators and duality in Hilbert spaces, together with diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators.
learningOutcomes.sv: You will learn about norms and inner products in infinite-dimensional vector spaces. Related to these structures, you will understand basic properties of bounded linear operators and duality in Hilbert spaces, together with diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators.
learningOutcomes.en: You will learn about norms and inner products in infinite-dimensional vector spaces. Related to these structures, you will understand basic properties of bounded linear operators and duality in Hilbert spaces, together with diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators.

content.fi: Orthogonality, orthonormal bases, bounded linear operators, functionals, and elementary spectral theory in Hilbert spaces. (Jordan-von Neuman Theorem, Riesz Hilbert Space Representation Theorem, diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators, Hilbert-Schmidt Spectral Theorem, Singular Value Decomposition).
content.sv: Orthogonality, orthonormal bases, bounded linear operators, functionals, and elementary spectral theory in Hilbert spaces. (Jordan-von Neuman Theorem, Riesz Hilbert Space Representation Theorem, diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators, Hilbert-Schmidt Spectral Theorem, Singular Value Decomposition).
content.en: Orthogonality, orthonormal bases, bounded linear operators, functionals, and elementary spectral theory in Hilbert spaces. (Jordan-von Neuman Theorem, Riesz Hilbert Space Representation Theorem, diagonalization of compact self-adjoint operators, Hilbert-Schmidt Spectral Theorem, Singular Value Decomposition).

assesmentMethods.fi: Weekly exercises (1/3) and an exam (2/3). Alternatively, just exam (100%).
assesmentMethods.sv: Weekly exercises (1/3) and an exam (2/3). Alternatively, just exam (100%).
assesmentMethods.en: Weekly exercises (1/3) and an exam (2/3). Alternatively, just exam (100%).

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

workload.fi: Independent study.
workload.sv: Independent study.
workload.en: Independent study.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: You are expected to have: - A good command of basic differential and integral calculus, including number sequences and series (eg MS-A0101 Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1) - Some familiarity of working with abstract sets, relations, and functions (eg MS-A0401 Diskreetin matematiikan perusteet) - Some familiarity with basic concepts of probability and statistics (eg MS-A0501 Todennäköisyyslaskennan ja tilastotieteen peruskurssi) The course is easier to follow for those familiar with product spaces and open sets in Euclidean spaces (eg MS-C1541 Metric Spaces). No preliminary knowledge in measure theory is required. However, those aiming to gain a deeper foundational insight are recommended to take a course in measure theory (eg MS-E1280 Measure and Integral) before or after this course.

However, those aiming to gain a deeper foundational insight are recommended to take a course in measure theory (eg MS-E1280 Measure and Integral) before or after this course.

No preliminary knowledge in measure theory is required. However, those aiming to gain a deeper foundational insight are recommended to take a course in measure theory (eg MS-E1280 Measure and Integral) before or after this course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
This course equips you with a deep and rigorous understanding of probability theory. It provides the mathematical tools and abstract concepts necessary to model and analyse complex probabilistic phenomena, apply advanced statistical techniques, and engage in research and applications in mathematics, statistics, machine learning, and other fields.  What you will learn:
  • Develop a strong understanding of probability spaces and sigma-algebras, enabling you to operate with random numbers, vectors, and sequences as measurable functions.
  • Compute probabilities, expected values, variances, and correlations by integrating with respect to a probability measure.
  • Apply products of probability measures and probability kernels to model and analyse stochastic independence and conditional probabilities.
  • Get introduced to key convergence concepts of random sequences (almost sure, in probability) and classical limit laws of random sequences.
  • Become familiar with key statistical distances (total variation, Wasserstein) and information-theoretic divergences (eg Kullback–Leibler) to quantify the difference between two probability distributions.

  • Become familiar with key statistical distances (total variation, Wasserstein) and information-theoretic divergences (eg Kullback–Leibler) to quantify the difference between two probability distributions.

content.fi:
This course provides a unified foundation of probability theory in a general measure-theoretic framework where random variables are represented as functions on an abstract measurable space that is equipped with a probability measure from which all probabilities, expected values, and correlations associated with a given stochastic model can be computed. Key concepts:
  • Random numbers, vectors, and sequences as measurable functions.
  • Integration with respect to a general probability measure.
  • Probability kernels for modelling conditional probabilities.
  • Convergence of random sequences and probability measures.
  • Distances and divergences between probability measures.

  • Distances and divergences between probability measures.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: You are expected to have: - A good command of basic differential and integral calculus, including number sequences and series (eg MS-A0101 Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 1) - Some familiarity of working with abstract sets, relations, and functions (eg MS-A0401 Diskreetin matematiikan perusteet) - Some familiarity with basic concepts of probability and statistics (eg MS-A0501 Todennäköisyyslaskennan ja tilastotieteen peruskurssi) The course is easier to follow for those familiar with product spaces and open sets in Euclidean spaces (eg MS-C1541 Metric Spaces). No preliminary knowledge in measure theory is required. However, those aiming to gain a deeper foundational insight are recommended to take a course in measure theory (eg MS-E1280 Measure and Integral) before or after this course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
This course equips you with a deep and rigorous understanding of probability theory. It provides the mathematical tools and abstract concepts necessary to model and analyse complex probabilistic phenomena, apply advanced statistical techniques, and engage in research and applications in mathematics, statistics, machine learning, and other fields.  What you will learn:
  • Develop a strong understanding of probability spaces and sigma-algebras, enabling you to operate with random numbers, vectors, and sequences as measurable functions.
  • Compute probabilities, expected values, variances, and correlations by integrating with respect to a probability measure.
  • Apply products of probability measures and probability kernels to model and analyse stochastic independence and conditional probabilities.
  • Get introduced to key convergence concepts of random sequences (almost sure, in probability) and classical limit laws of random sequences.
  • Become familiar with key statistical distances (total variation, Wasserstein) and information-theoretic divergences (eg Kullback–Leibler) to quantify the difference between two probability distributions.

content.fi:
This course provides a unified foundation of probability theory in a general measure-theoretic framework where random variables are represented as functions on an abstract measurable space that is equipped with a probability measure from which all probabilities, expected values, and correlations associated with a given stochastic model can be computed. Key concepts:
  • Random numbers, vectors, and sequences as measurable functions.
  • Integration with respect to a general probability measure.
  • Probability kernels for modelling conditional probabilities.
  • Convergence of random sequences and probability measures.
  • Distances and divergences between probability measures.

learningOutcomes.fi:
This course introduces you to mathematical concepts and methods used in analysing high-dimensional data. What you will learn:
  • Formulate sparse high-dimensional statistical models mathematically.
  • Apply random matrix theory to understand statistical features in high dimensions.
  • Utilise low-dimensional structures (sparsity, low rank) to tame the curse of dimensionality.
learningOutcomes.sv:

content.fi:
Modern applications of data science and machine learning commonly deal with high-dimensional data in which the number variables is large. This course focuses on mathematical concepts developed for understanding the interplay of dimensions, sparsity, and complexity in such datasets and associated stochastic models. Key concepts:
  • Sub-Gaussian and sub-exponential probability distributions.
  • Concentration inequalities of random matrices and their singular values.
  • Random projections in Euclidean spaces.
  • Covering numbers and metric entropy of sets.
  • Applications to dimension reduction, sparse regression, and network clustering.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students learn to analyze and solve problems in linear algebra that occur often in scientific computing, data fitting and optimization. The main focus is on solution of sparse linear systems. After the course, the students can choose the best solution method for each problem and have a good understanding on issues related to numerical stability of the applied algorithms.

prerequisites.fi: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX. The courses MS-A03XX, MS-C134X, MS-C1350, MS-C1650 may also be useful.
prerequisites.sv: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX. The courses MS-A03XX, MS-C134X, MS-C1350, MS-C1650 may also be useful.
prerequisites.en: MS-A00XX, MS-A01XX, MS-A02XX. The courses MS-A03XX, MS-C134X, MS-C1350, MS-C1650 may also be useful.

learningOutcomes.fi: You will familiarize yourself with the basic properties of initial value problems for systems of ordinary differential equations. You will learn the fundamental theory about linear multistep methods (definition, consistency, zero-stability, convergence) and Runge-Kutta methods (definition, order conditions, convergence). You will learn to identify a stiff system and to understand the difference between explicit and implicit numerical schemes. You will understand the signifigance of absolute stability and A-stability, and know how to examine the region of absolute stability for a given numerical method. You will familiarize yourself with simple parabolic and hyperpolic initial/boundary value problems and learn how to discretize them with the help of difference schemes. You will practice implementing the introduced methods numerically.

You will understand the signifigance of absolute stability and A-stability, and know how to examine the region of absolute stability for a given numerical method. You will familiarize yourself with simple parabolic and hyperpolic initial/boundary value problems and learn how to discretize them with the help of difference schemes. You will practice implementing the introduced methods numerically.

You will familiarize yourself with simple parabolic and hyperpolic initial/boundary value problems and learn how to discretize them with the help of difference schemes. You will practice implementing the introduced methods numerically.

content.fi: Basic existence and uniqueness results for systems of ordinary differential equations. Linear multistep methods and Runge-Kutta methods: stability, convergence and numerical implementation. Discretization of simple initial/boundary value problems for parabolic and hyperbolic partial differential equations.

Linear multistep methods and Runge-Kutta methods: stability, convergence and numerical implementation. Discretization of simple initial/boundary value problems for parabolic and hyperbolic partial differential equations.

workload.fi: Lectures 24h (2), Exercises 24h (2), Project work 40h, Homework assignments 30 h, reading and studying the lecture materials 20 h

workload.en: Lectures 24h (2), Exercises 24h (2), Project work 40h, Homework assignments 30 h, reading and studying the lecture materials 20 h

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: At least one statistics/probability course (preferably MS-C1620 Statistical Inference or equivalent) and one matrix algebra course.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: At least one statistics/probability course (preferably MS-C1620 Statistical Inference or equivalent) and one matrix algebra course.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: At least one statistics/probability course (preferably MS-C1620 Statistical Inference or equivalent) and one matrix algebra course.

learningOutcomes.fi: After passing the course the students can conduct simple multivariate statistical analyses. They are familiar with common multivariate data analysis techniques. Students are familiar with different multivariate location and scatter functionals and the corresponding estimates and they understand the basic properties of these functionals. Students know how to apply principal component analysis and how to robustify the method. Students can conduct bivariate and multiple correspondence analysis and interpret the findings. Students are familiar with canonical correlation analysis and they can apply the method in practice. Students know several approaches to discriminant analysis and classification including different depth based methods. They are also able to assess the goodness of the classification. Students are familiar with hierarchical clustering methods and moving centers -type clustering methods and they understand the restrictions of these approaches. Moreover, students are not only able to apply multivariate methods in practice, but they also understand the mathematics and the reasoning behind the methods.
learningOutcomes.sv: After passing the course the students can conduct simple multivariate statistical analyses. They are familiar with common multivariate data analysis techniques. Students are familiar with different multivariate location and scatter functionals and the corresponding estimates and they understand the basic properties of these functionals. Students know how to apply principal component analysis and how to robustify the method. Students can conduct bivariate and multiple correspondence analysis and interpret the findings. Students are familiar with canonical correlation analysis and they can apply the method in practice. Students know several approaches to discriminant analysis and classification including different depth based methods. They are also able to assess the goodness of the classification. Students are familiar with hierarchical clustering methods and moving centers -type clustering methods and they understand the restrictions of these approaches. Moreover, students are not only able to apply multivariate methods in practice, but they also understand the mathematics and the reasoning behind the methods.
learningOutcomes.en: After passing the course the students can conduct simple multivariate statistical analyses. They are familiar with common multivariate data analysis techniques. Students are familiar with different multivariate location and scatter functionals and the corresponding estimates and they understand the basic properties of these functionals. Students know how to apply principal component analysis and how to robustify the method. Students can conduct bivariate and multiple correspondence analysis and interpret the findings. Students are familiar with canonical correlation analysis and they can apply the method in practice. Students know several approaches to discriminant analysis and classification including different depth based methods. They are also able to assess the goodness of the classification. Students are familiar with hierarchical clustering methods and moving centers -type clustering methods and they understand the restrictions of these approaches. Moreover, students are not only able to apply multivariate methods in practice, but they also understand the mathematics and the reasoning behind the methods.

content.fi: The course is an introduction to multivariate statistical analysis. Course topics include multivariate location and scatter, principal component analysis (PCA), robustness and robust PCA, bivariate correspondence analysis, multiple correspondence analysis (MCA), canonical correlation analysis, discriminant analysis, statistical depth functions, classification and clustering. Software R is used in the exercises of this course.
content.sv: The course is an introduction to multivariate statistical analysis. Course topics include multivariate location and scatter, principal component analysis (PCA), robustness and robust PCA, bivariate correspondence analysis, multiple correspondence analysis (MCA), canonical correlation analysis, discriminant analysis, statistical depth functions, classification and clustering. Software R is used in the exercises of this course.
content.en: The course is an introduction to multivariate statistical analysis. Course topics include multivariate location and scatter, principal component analysis (PCA), robustness and robust PCA, bivariate correspondence analysis, multiple correspondence analysis (MCA), canonical correlation analysis, discriminant analysis, statistical depth functions, classification and clustering. Software R is used in the exercises of this course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The student has a good understanding of the key concepts and methods of investment science, including topics such as interests rates; cash flow analysis; Markowitz' portfolio theory; capital asset pricing model; arbitrage pricing theory; forward, futures and option contracts; pricing of options; hedging; interest rate derivatives; interest rate dynamics. 
The student is able to formulate and solve problems involving financial instruments. The student has a strong foundation for pursuing advanced studies in financial engineering and quantitative finance.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A05XX Todennäköisyyslaskennan ja tilastotieteen peruskurssi
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A05XX Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics

learningOutcomes.fi: Opiskelija hallitsee riskianalyysin keskeiset käsitteet ja menetelmät sekä osaa soveltaa niitä teknisten järjestelmiä koskevissa tarkasteluissa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Studenten känner till de centrala begreppen och metoderna för riskanalys och kan tilllämpa dem för att undersöka tekniska system.
learningOutcomes.en: The student knows the central concepts and methods of risk analysis and is able to apply them to the study of engineering systems.

content.fi: Kurssi perehdyttää riskinalyysin keskeisimpiin menetelmiin ja antaa valmiudet soveltaa niitä erilaisten teknis-taloudellisten järjestelmien riskitarkasteluissa (ml. riskien tunnistaminen ja arviointi, riskienhallintatoimenpiteiden vertailu ja priorisointi, riskiviestintä). Käsiteltäviä menetelmiä ovat muun muassa vikapuut, syy-seuraus-kaaviot sekä todennäköisyyspohjainen turvallisuusanalyysi. Kurssilla perehdytään myös todennäköisyyksien estimointiin sekä asiantuntija-arvioiden että tilastollisten menetelmien pohjalta. Luennot ja laskuharjoitukset sisältävät riskianalyysien laatimista ja käyttöä havainnollistavia esimerkkejä.
content.sv: Kursen introducerar de viktigaste metoderna för riskanalys och ger färdigheter i att tillämpa dem vid riskbedömning av olika tekniska och ekonomiska system (inkl. riskidentifiering och riskbedömning, utvärdering och prioritering av riskhanteringsåtgärder, riskkommunikation). Bland de metoder som behandlas ingår felträd, orsak-verkan-diagram och probabilistisk säkerhetsanalys. Kursen behandlar även uppskattning av sannolikheter med hjälp av både expertbedömningar och statistiska metoder. Föreläsningar och beräkningsövningar inkluderar exempel som illustrerar utvecklingen och användningen av riskanalyser.
content.en: The course covers the main methods of risk analysis and their applications in risk assessment of various techno-economic systems (including risk identification and assessment, comparison and prioritisation of risk management measures, risk communication). Methods to be considered include fault trees, cause and effect diagrams and probabilistic safety analysis. The course will also cover probability estimation based on both expert judgement and statistical methods. Lectures and computational exercises will include examples illustrating the development and use of risk analyses.

name.en: The resilience of Finnish society, Lecture

workload.fi:
1 op: osallistuminen riittävän monelle luennolle
5 op: Osallistuminen riittävän monelle luennolle, harjoitustyöt ja tentti
workload.sv:
1 poäng: närvaro vid ett tillräckligt antal föreläsningar
5 poäng: närvaro vid ett tillräckligt antal föreläsningar, övningar och tentamen
workload.en:
1 credit: attending a sufficient number of lectures
5 credits: attending of a sufficient number of lectures, exercises and exam

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Ei esitietovaatimuksia.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: inga förkunskapskrav.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: No prerequisites.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija ymmärtää:
* Mitä keskeiset kriittiset infrastruktuurit ovat ja millaisia ovat niiden keskinäisriippuvudet
* Kriittisiin infrastruktuureihin ja niiden analysointiin liittyvät keskeiset käsitteet
* Riskianalyysin lähtökohdat
* Millaisia uhkia suomalaiseen yhteiskuntaan arvioidaan kohdistuvan ja miten suomalainen yhteiskunta on varautunut näihin uhkiin
* Miten kriittisiä infrastruktuureja ja niiden resilienssiä voidaan analysoida.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avslutad kurs kommer deltagarna att förstå* Vilka de viktigaste kritiska infrastrukturerna är och hur de är beroende av varandra* Nyckelbegrepp relaterade till kritiska infrastrukturer och deras analys* Grunderna i riskanalys* Hoten mot det finska samhället och hur det finska samhället har förberett sig för dessa hot* Hur kritiska infrastrukturer och deras motståndskraft kan analyseras.
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, students will understand:* What the key critical infrastructures are and how they are interdependent* Key concepts related to critical infrastructures and their analysis* The basics of risk analysis* The threats to Finnish society and how Finnish society has prepared for these threats* How critical infrastructures and their resilience can be analysed.

content.fi: Kriittiset infrastruktuurit, riskianalyysin perusteet, kriittisten infrastruktuurien kytkeytyneisyys, analyysimenetelmiä, case-esimerkkejä, turvallisuus, resilienssi, suomalaisen yhteiskunnan varautuminen.
content.sv: Kritiska infrastrukturer, grunderna i riskanalys, hur kritiska infrastrukturer är sammankopplade, analysmetoder, case-exempel, säkerhet, resiliens, det finländska samhällets beredskap.
content.en: Critical infrastructures, basics of risk analysis, interconnectedness of critical infrastructures, analysis methods, case examples, security, resilience, preparedness of Finnish society.
